intro: Hieracium piceiceps, commonly known as the black-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are broadly lanceolate. Its flowers are yellow, with a prominent dark central disk, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Hieracium piceiceps is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as meadows and roadsides.
